concept.title: Eucalyptus Upgrade
concept.shortdesc: This section details the tasks you need to perform in order to upgrade your current version of Eucalyptus.

conbody.p: You can upgrade to Eucalyptus from or 4.0.2; see the prescribed paths below. Follow the directions in that version's Installation Guide in the documentation archive, and then upgrade to using the directions in this section.
You do not need to shut down instances in order to upgrade. However, Auto Scaling instances will likely shut down and be replaced, based on each group's scaling policy and health check criteria.
conbody.note:
If you want to upgrade from a release prior to 4.0.2, follow the prescribed upgrade path as shown:
Upgrade from 3.1.2 -> 3.2.2
Upgrade from 3.2.2 -> 3.3.2
Upgrade from 3.3.2 -> 3.4.3
Upgrade from 3.4.3 -> 4.0.2

Eucalyptus does not support components that are at different releases, even at the sub-minor level. For example, you cannot have a CLC at and a Walrus at . Make sure that you update all Eucalyptus components when you upgrade.
